Pakkaṭṭhī，（f．） [fr．pa+kvat，evidently as abstr．to pakkaṭṭhita； reading uncertain] a boiling （-hot） mixture （of oil?） M．I，87，expld by C．as katita- （=kaṭh°） gomaya，boiling cow-dung，v．l．chakaṇakā see p．537．The id．p．at Nd2 199 reads chakaṇaṭī，evidently a bona fide reading．The interpretation as “cow-dung” is more likely than “boiling oil．” （Page 380）
